item.title: Section With Articles
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" equal_height="yes" css=".vc_custom_1493379474981{padding-top: 35px !important;padding-bottom: 35px !important;background-image: url(http://localhost/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/01-banana-image.jpg?id=3702) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1493376887156{background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.9) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;*background-color: rgb(255,255,255) !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="LEAN MOVEMENT" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:40|text_align:center|color:%2321a6ce" google_fonts="font_family:Text%20Me%20One%3Aregular|font_style:400%20regular%3A400%3Anormal" css=".vc_custom_1493377405908{padding-top: 50px !important;padding-right: 50px !important;padding-left: 50px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1493377257239{padding-right: 50px !important;padding-left: 50px !important;}"]

Some areas, such as Hong Kong, have preferred to shape their policy around a tighter focus on copyright ownership in the value chain. They adopt the WIPO's classifications, which divide up the creative industries according to who owns the copyrights at various stages during the production and distribution of creative content.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Read More" style="custom" custom_background="#21a6ce" custom_text="#ffffff" shape="square" align="center" css=".vc_custom_1493376960920{padding-bottom: 50px !important;}"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1493377028647{background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.9) !important;*background-color: rgb(255,255,255) !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="DIGITAL INDUSTRY" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:40|text_align:center|color:%2321a6ce" google_fonts="font_family:Text%20Me%20One%3Aregular|font_style:400%20regular%3A400%3Anormal" css=".vc_custom_1493377397402{padding-top: 50px !important;padding-right: 50px !important;padding-left: 50px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1493377282800{padding-right: 50px !important;padding-left: 50px !important;}"]

The primary purpose of this is to quantify - for example it can be used to count the number of firms, and the number of workers, creatively employed in any given location, and hence to identify places with particularly high concentrations of creative activities.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Read More" style="custom" custom_background="#21a6ce" custom_text="#ffffff" shape="square" align="center" css=".vc_custom_1493376960920{padding-bottom: 50px !important;}"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1493377013202{background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.9) !important;*background-color: rgb(255,255,255) !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="CREATIVE CULTURE" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:40|text_align:center|color:%2321a6ce" google_fonts="font_family:Text%20Me%20One%3Aregular|font_style:400%20regular%3A400%3Anormal" css=".vc_custom_1493377379334{padding-top: 50px !important;padding-right: 50px !important;padding-left: 50px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1493377305929{padding-right: 50px !important;padding-left: 50px !important;}"]

There is often a question about the boundaries between creative industries and the similar term of cultural industries. Cultural industries are best described as an adjunct-sector of the creative industries.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Read More" style="custom" custom_background="#21a6ce" custom_text="#ffffff" shape="square" align="center" css=".vc_custom_1493376960920{padding-bottom: 50px !important;}"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1493376985301{background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.9) !important;*background-color: rgb(255,255,255) !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="HOST A CONFERENCE" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:40|text_align:center|color:%2321a6ce" google_fonts="font_family:Text%20Me%20One%3Aregular|font_style:400%20regular%3A400%3Anormal" css=".vc_custom_1493377420656{padding-top: 50px !important;padding-right: 50px !important;padding-left: 50px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1493377320712{padding-right: 50px !important;padding-left: 50px !important;}"]

Cultural industries include industries that focus on cultural tourism and heritage, museums and libraries, sports and outdoor activities, and a variety of 'way of life' activities that arguably range from local pet shows to a host of hobbyist concerns.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Read More" style="custom" custom_background="#21a6ce" custom_text="#ffffff" shape="square" align="center" css=".vc_custom_1493376960920{padding-bottom: 50px !important;}"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
